locations.name: Littleroot Town
locations.description: Basking amid vibrant nature, this simple town is not shaded with any one hue.

locations.name: Oldale Town
locations.description: A town where the contrast between colorful flowers and deep, verdant forests is most beautiful.

locations.name: Petalburg City
locations.description: A whiff of salt is always in the air in this city, which is skirted by the ocean shore.

locations.name: Rustboro City
locations.description: This city is the main hub of industry in the Hoenn region, with the Devon Corporation as its beating heart.

locations.name: Dewford Town
locations.description: New trends are always the rage among the inhabitants of this small island town.

locations.name: Slateport City
locations.description: People from many different regions gather and mingle in this bustling port city.

locations.name: Mauville City
locations.description: This large city is located in the heart of the Hoenn region, at the crossroads of its nostalgic past and new technology.

locations.name: Verdanturf Town
locations.description: Thanks to the prevailing wind pattern, this town is always kept clear of falling volcanic ash.

locations.name: Fallarbor Town
locations.description: A town formed by scholars who gather to research meteorites.

locations.name: Lavaridge Town
locations.description: A popular spot in the Hoenn region, thanks to its hot springs, said to cure any ailment.

locations.name: Fortree City
locations.description: The people and the Pokémon of this city follow nature's cues to rise each morning and end each day.

locations.name: Lilycove City
locations.description: This tourist destination is undergoing a revival, thanks to the popularity of its Pokémon Contest Spectaculars.

locations.name: Mossdeep City
locations.description: Research is underway day and night in this city, all in the hope of understanding the distant reaches of space.

locations.name: Sootopolis City
locations.description: This city, which rises from the crater of a great meteoroid crash, can only be reached through the sea or from the sky.

locations.name: Pacifidlog Town
locations.description: This town first came into being as a floating storehouse used by people living on the ocean's surface.

locations.name: Ever Grande City
locations.description: This city is blanketed in a profusion of colorful blooms. It plays host to the grand Pokémon League.

locations.name: Battle Frontier
locations.description: An island south of Route 130 that features several arenas where powerful Trainers can battle each other. The Battle Frontier is composed of seven distinct battle facilities, each lead by a Frontier Brain who may be challenged after certain winning streaks have been made through their respective facility.

locations.name: Battle Resort
locations.description: This grand resort was built with the aim of allowing Trainers to enjoy every kind of Pokémon battle.

locations.name: Route 101
locations.description: This grassy path running between Littleroot Town and Oldale Town is perfect for doing fieldwork.

locations.name: Route 102
locations.description: Many Trainers gather on this route in the hope of encountering Pokémon in the wild.

locations.name: Route 103
locations.description: On weekends and holidays, fishing enthusiasts flock to every section of coastline on this seaside route.

locations.name: Route 104
locations.description: This path, rich with water and colorful plant life, runs north and south of Petalburg Woods.

locations.name: Route 105
locations.description: This water route boasts gentle currents, which makes it safe for even poor swimmers to bask in.

locations.name: Route 106
locations.description: This is the site of serious battles between Fishermen of the seaside area and the wild Pokémon of the seas.

locations.name: Route 107
locations.description: The local children of Dewford Town practice long-distance swimming in the waters of this aquatic route.

locations.name: Route 108
locations.description: People come swimming from as far away as the Kalos region to see the site of Sea Mauville.

locations.name: Route 109
locations.description: People and Pokémon alike enjoy ocean swims in this water route.

locations.name: Route 110
locations.description: A timeworn path where nature remains untouched. Above it on this route stretches the huge Cycling Road.

locations.name: Route 111
locations.description: This expansive route includes a desert where sandstorms rage unceasingly and a mountain pass.

locations.name: Route 112
locations.description: This route is popular among Trainers because it offers the chance to stroll while gazing up at Mt. Chimney.

locations.name: Route 113
locations.description: The tall grass on this route is painted a dusty gray by the volcanic ash that pours from Mt. Chimney.

locations.name: Route 114
locations.description: This mountain path to Meteor Falls is so long and arduous that even Hikers have difficulty tackling it.

locations.name: Route 115
locations.description: This trail to Rustboro City was broken by people who lived at Meteor Falls long ago.

locations.name: Route 116
locations.description: A path that many workers take on their daily commute between Rustboro City and Rusturf Tunnel.

locations.name: Route 117
locations.description: A path where many Trainers gather to raise their Pokémon and train them for battle.

locations.name: Route 118
locations.description: This seaside route brings together the east and west sides of the Hoenn region.

locations.name: Route 119
locations.description: If you are not prepared for it, the harsh conditions of this tropical rain forest will defeat you in less than five minutes.

locations.name: Route 120
locations.description: Pokémon that can camouflage themselves hide in the rich wilds along this route.

locations.name: Route 121
locations.description: This road leads to both the Safari Zone and Mt. Pyre. Many people set out along this route from Lilycove City.

locations.name: Route 122
locations.description: People make their way to Mt. Pyre over this water route, reliving many precious memories as they traverse it.

locations.name: Route 123
locations.description: This route offers a convenient path back to Mauville City from Mt. Pyre, but be aware that it is a one-way road.

locations.name: Route 124
locations.description: This great stretch of ocean connects the cities of Lilycove, Mossdeep, and Sootopolis.

locations.name: Route 125
locations.description: This route offers a convenient path back to Mauville City from Mt. Pyre, but be aware that it is a one-way road.

locations.name: Route 126
locations.description: Even a pro swimmer would need three entire days to circuit around the crater containing Sootopolis City.

locations.name: Route 127
locations.description: With no place to stop and rest in these waters, it is very hard for a swimmer to make it across this route.

locations.name: Route 128
locations.description: The ocean floor beneath this water route is rumored to contain an undiscovered ruin.

locations.name: Route 129
locations.description: Many Pokémon Trainers visit this route to train their Pokémon before challenging the Pokémon League.

locations.name: Route 130
locations.description: This route was once a big topic of conversation due to a strange island that seemed to appear and then disappear.

locations.name: Route 131
locations.description: It is the custom in Pacifidlog Town to swim a lap around this route before breakfast.

locations.name: Route 132
locations.description: The children of Pacifidlog Town are said to be such strong swimmers that they frolic and play in these fierce currents.

locations.name: Route 133
locations.description: Trainers gather in this stretch of sea in search of something beyond its fierce currents.

locations.name: Route 134
locations.description: This route is rather a famous diving spot among those who love exploring ancient ruins.

locations.name: Petalburg Woods
locations.description: This dense forest, with its abundance of trees, is well known to be a favorite habitat for Shroomish.

locations.name: Rusturf Tunnel
locations.description: This stone tunnel links together Rustboro and Verdanturf. Its name was chosen as a mixture of the two.

locations.name: Island Cave
locations.description: A small island on Route 105. The cave on this island is freezing cold.

locations.name: Granite Cave
locations.description: This cavern is famous for its cave art, which depicts events from thousands of years ago.

locations.name: Sea Mauville
locations.description: A facility that was decommissioned dozens of years ago. It is now maintained as a natural preserve.

locations.name: Oceanic Museum
locations.description: A museum dedicated to how the sea sustains life.

locations.name: Seaside Cycling Road
locations.description: A facility that was decommissioned dozens of years ago. It is now maintained as a natural preserve.

locations.name: Trick House
locations.description: Home of the Trick Master. Those who wish to play his game must find their way through a maze-like puzzle at the back of his house. If successful, they will be rewarded.

locations.name: Seaside Cycling Road
locations.description: Though it was planned to be a subterranean city extending 69 floors underground, this project died in development.

locations.name: Desert Ruins
locations.description: A strange ruin found in the desert. The rock formations here are highly unusual.

locations.name: Mirage Tower
locations.description: A rocky tower that in the desert that is rumored to only be visible at certain times. There are people who claim to have found fossils in this tower.

locations.name: Fiery Path
locations.description: The Pokémon that live in this area like to use the steam that erupts from the ground as a sort of bath.

locations.name: Jagged Pass
locations.description: This mountain route is the result of a volcanic eruption in ages long past. It can only be traversed on an Acro Bike.

locations.name: Mt. Chimney
locations.description: This volcano towers to a height of nearly 5,000 feet (1,500 meters). The view from its peak is beyond compare.

locations.name: Desert Underpass
locations.description: A long underground tunnel that runs below Route 114. Fossils that sink under the sands of the desert occasionally wind up down here.

locations.name: Meteor Falls
locations.description: This waterfall is said to have been the site of a meteor shower. An ancient people once made their home here.

locations.name: Weather Institute
locations.description: The Weather Institute checks and keeps track of weather conditions throughout Hoenn. Its main project is the weather control machine which allows them to change the weather in certain areas.

locations.name: Scorched Slab
locations.description: A small cave that rises out of a lake on Route 120. This cave's abnormally high temperature is rumored to be caused by a Pokémon.

locations.name: Ancient Tomb
locations.description: The water that flows through this cave contains a high amount of iron.

locations.name: Safari Zone
locations.description: This amusement area provides a rich environment in which to catch many different kinds of Pokémon.

locations.name: Mt. Pyre
locations.description: The mountain is where spirits of Pokémon have rested and will always rest: past, present, and future.

locations.name: Lilycove Museum
locations.description: This museum features a collection of fantastic artwork showcasing Pokémon and Contests. Most of the exhibits on the first floor are classical statues and sculptures featuring or symbolizing Pokémon, while the second floor is home to modern and vibrant artworks of Pokémon.

locations.name: Shoal Cave
locations.description: This cave's appearance changes greatly between high tide and low tide.

locations.name: Team Aqua Hideout
locations.description: This oceanic cavern is believed to be the base of operations for Team Aqua.

locations.name: Team Magma Hideout
locations.description: This volcanic cavern is believed to be the base of operations for Team Magma.

locations.name: Mossdeep Space Center
locations.description: A space center located on the northeast corner of Mossdeep City. This destination was chosen because of Mossdeep's ideal weather, clear and sunny with stable winds. The Space Center successfully sends rockets into space, though specifics of the space missions are unknown.

locations.name: Seafloor Cavern
locations.description: It is said that a Pokémon once dwelled here in the ancient mists of a time long past.

locations.name: Cave of Origin
locations.description: A long-sleeping Pokémon will descend upon this cavern in order to awaken its true powers.

locations.name: Mirage Island
locations.description: This island's visibility changes every day for unknown reasons. Nobody has ever been able to successfully locate this island on days when it isn't visible.

locations.name: Sky Pillar
locations.description: This tower was created for the veneration of a Legendary Pokémon that lives far above in the heavens.

locations.name: Victory Road
locations.description: This challenging path forces Trainers who hope to overcome the Pokémon League to first surpass their own limits.

locations.name: Sealed Chamber
locations.description: Ancient Braille text is inscribed on rocks in this undersea cavern.

locations.name: Artisan Cave
locations.description: This cave runs under the Battle Frontier. It is named after the several Smeargle that inhabit it.

locations.name: Altering Cave
locations.description: This island has been known by this name since the distant past. No one today knows where it got this name, however.

locations.name: Southern Island
locations.description: This small island is surrounded by a mysterious veil that makes approach impossible for mere humans.

locations.name: Marine Cave
locations.description: This unusual cave has been known to change locations. It is always found emerged from the sea.

locations.name: Terra Cave
locations.description: This unusual cave has been known to change locations. It is always found emerged from the ground.

locations.name: S.S. Tidal
locations.description: A ferry from the Hoenn region. Its captain is Mr. Briney. The S.S. Tidal transports players from one location to another. Its main voyage takes players from Lilycove City to Slateport City and vice versa, but other tickets allow other locations to be reached.

locations.name: Mirage Caves
locations.description: It is said that these caves can only be spotted with the help of Latias or Latios.

locations.name: Mirage Forests
locations.description: It is said that forests caves can only be spotted with the help of Latias or Latios.

locations.name: Mirage Islands
locations.description: It is said that these islands can only be spotted with the help of Latias or Latios.

locations.name: Mirage Mountains
locations.description: It is said that these mountains can only be spotted with the help of Latias or Latios.

locations.name: Faraway Island
locations.description: A tropical island located far from the Hoenn mainland. The legendary Pokémon Mew was studied here a long time ago.
